projectPurpose: To provide a starter template and structure for solving Advent of Code programming challenges using the Rust programming language.
mainFeatures: Starter project template for Advent of Code
Configured for the Rust programming language
Reduces initial setup time for participants

alternatives.name: gahjelle/template-aoc-python
alternatives.license: Open Source (MIT or similar, common for GitHub templates)

alternatives.name: bcooperstl/advent-of-code-cpp-starter
alternatives.license: Open Source (MIT or similar, common for GitHub templates)
mainFeatures: Starter template for Advent of Code in C++

alternatives.name: devries/aoc_template
alternatives.license: Open Source (MIT or similar, common for GitHub templates)
mainFeatures: Template for Advent of Code in Go
Puts problems into a single executable
Commands for starting days and running solutions

alternatives.name: JetBrains Kotlin Template
alternatives.license: Open Source (likely Apache 2.0 or MIT, common for JetBrains projects)
platforms: Cross-platform (requires Kotlin environment, often used with IntelliJ IDEA)
mainFeatures: Official Advent of Code template for Kotlin

marketPositioning: advent-of-code-rust is positioned as a language-specific tool within the broader Advent of Code community, offering a tailored starter experience for Rust developers. It competes indirectly with starter templates and helper libraries available for other programming languages by providing a Rust-native environment to solve the challenges. Its unique value proposition lies in catering specifically to the Rust ecosystem, enabling developers familiar with or learning Rust to efficiently participate in Advent of Code without significant language-specific setup hurdles.
